description: The categorised quantities of the ('managed') waste generated by households.
sourcing notes: Published as an RDF data cube, the data can be accessed via SPARQL.

description: The carbon impact of the waste generated by households.
sourcing notes: Published through a web-based data tool, the data can be downloaded as a CSV file.

description: The categorised quantities of the waste generated by industry & commerce.
sourcing notes: Published as a series of downloadable Excel files.

description: The categorised quantities of the waste generated by industry & commerce.
sourcing notes: Published as a series of downloadable Excel files.

description: The locations, services & capacities of waste sites.
sourcing notes: Published through a web-based data tool, the data can be downloaded as a CSV file.

description: The categorised quantities of waste going in and out of waste sites.
sourcing notes: Published through a web-based data tool, the data can be downloaded as a CSV file.

description: A mapping between the EWC codes and SEPA's materials classification (as used in these datasets).
sourcing notes: Published through a web-based data tool, the data can be downloaded as CSV files.

description: EWC (European Waste Classification) codes and descriptions.
Occupied residential dwelling counts. Useful for calculating per-household amounts.
sourcing notes: Published as an RDF data cube, the data can be accessed via SPARQL.

description: People counts. Useful for calculating per-citizen amounts.
sourcing notes: Published as an RDF data cube, the data can be accessed via SPARQL.
